website_summaries.verdict: At under $7, this affordable little knife wins points for it's sharp-edged utility.
pros: This handy little knife comes at an almost-too-good-to-be-true price, but still cuts tomatoes and other soft foods with ease
Not only that, but the sharp edge lasts and lasts
To sweeten the deal, this little workhorse is made in America and comes with a lifetime guarantee
cons: The thin blade is flexible so it only works on soft foods like tomatoes, fruit, or bread, and the knife is not dishwasher safe

customer_reviews.title: I love this knife.
customer_reviews.text: While this knife is advertised as a tomato knife, I use it for all sorts of things. It is my husband's favorite knife for the dinner table. I use it to slice open buns, muffins, English muffins, anything that benefits from the sharp point and the serrated edge. I have purchased several as gifts.

customer_reviews.title: SHARP AND LOVE THE LOOK!!!
customer_reviews.text: It does what it is designed to do really well. Someone complained about not holding up to the dishwasher but I would not put a knife in the dishwasher so that is not a problem. I will look into their other knives because I am really impressed with the sharpness and the cool look of the knife. I have no idea about durability except that other customers rave about it, I have only had it for a couple of weeks. Unbelievably cheap for an excellent well made knife. Love it!

customer_reviews.title: Cuts tomatoes (pretty much anything else) very easily!
customer_reviews.text: While the knife feels a little bit small in your hand, I've learned to hold the knife gently and let the blade to the cutting. This knife truly cuts tomatoes without smashing the tomato or making a mess of things. I researched several other knives on Amazon but didn't find any that were so inexpensive yet so effective. I put my full stamp of approval on this knife! One thing to note is that the silver steel one isn't supposed to be put in the dishwasher. I hand wash this knife and dry it quickly in order to make it last. To me, that's not a big deal though because I try to hand wash all of the cutlery knives.
